peri_event_time_histogram¶

peri_event_time_histogram(spike_times, spike_clusters, events, cluster_id, t_before=0.2, t_after=0.5, bin_size=0.025, smoothing=0.025, as_rate=True, include_raster=False, n_rasters=None, error_bars='std', ax=None, pethline_kwargs={'color': 'blue', 'lw': 2}, errbar_kwargs={'alpha': 0.5, 'color': 'blue'}, eventline_kwargs={'alpha': 0.5, 'color': 'black'}, raster_kwargs={'color': 'black', 'lw': 0.5}, **kwargs)¶

Plot peri-event time histograms, with the meaning firing rate of units centered on a given series of events. Can optionally add a raster underneath the PETH plot of individual spike trains about the events.

Parameters

  • {array-like} -- Spike times (spike_times) –

  • {array-like} -- Cluster identities for each element of spikes (spike_clusters) –

  • {array-like} -- Times to align the histogram (events) –

  • {int} -- Identity of the cluster for which to plot a PETH (cluster_id) –

Keyword Arguments

  • {float} -- Time before event to plot (default (t_before) – {0.2})

  • {float} -- Time after event to plot (default (t_after) – {0.5})

  • {float} -- Width of bin for histograms (default (bin_size) – {0.025})

  • {float} -- sigma of gaussian smoothing to use in histograms. (default (smoothing) – {0.025})

  • {bool} -- Whether to use spike counts or rates in the plot (default (as_rate) – {False})

  • {bool} -- Whether to put a raster below the PETH of individual spike trains (include_raster) – (default: {False})

  • {int} -- If include_raster is True, the number of rasters to include. If None (n_rasters) – will default to plotting rasters around all provided events. (default: {None})

  • {str} -- Defines which type of error bars to plot. Options are (error_bars) – – ‘std’ for 1 standard deviation – ‘sem’ for standard error of the mean – ‘none’ for only plotting the mean value (default: {‘std’})

  • {matplotlib axes} -- If passed, the function will plot on the passed axes. Note (ax) – current behavior causes whatever was on the axes to be cleared before plotting! (default: {None})

  • {dict} -- Dict containing line properties to define PETH plot line. Default (pethline_kwargs) – is a blue line with weight of 2. Needs to have color. See matplotlib plot documentation for more options. (default: {‘color’: ‘blue’, ‘lw’: 2})

  • {dict} -- Dict containing fill-between properties to define PETH error bars. (errbar_kwargs) – Default is a blue fill with 50 percent opacity.. Needs to have color. See matplotlib fill_between documentation for more options. (default: {‘color’: ‘blue’, ‘alpha’: 0.5})

  • {dict} -- Dict containing fill-between properties to define line at event. (eventline_kwargs) – Default is a black line with 50 percent opacity.. Needs to have color. See matplotlib vlines documentation for more options. (default: {‘color’: ‘black’, ‘alpha’: 0.5})

  • {dict} -- Dict containing properties defining lines in the raster plot. (raster_kwargs) – Default is black lines with line width of 0.5. See matplotlib vlines for more options. (default: {‘color’: ‘black’, ‘lw’: 0.5})
